lead_paragraph: At the Justice Department’s urging, the F.B.I. did not actively pursue cases on the Clinton Foundation and a former Trump campaign chairman so close to the election.

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By MATT APUZZO, MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT, ADAM GOLDMAN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Disclosure Is Policy Shift Since Summer
headline.main: F.B.I.’s Email Disclosure Broke a Pattern Followed Even This Summer

snippet: At the Justice Department’s urging, the F.B.I. did not actively pursue cases on the Clinton Foundation and a former Trump campaign chairman so close to the election....
abstract: James B Comey's decision to alert Congress to possible new evidence in Hillary Clinton email investigation weeks before presidential election contradicts agreement FBI made with Justice Dept in summer 2016 not to publicize two other inquiries with potential to influence vote; other cases involved business dealings in Ukraine made by Donald J Trump's campaign chairman Paul Manafort and Hillary Clinton's relationships with those who donated to her family foundation.
